answers.answer: I had this from about 34 weeks and am now 40 weeks and it has gone as baby has dropped. The midwife said it was where the baby's feet were sat and it had torn some muscle tissue. It's really uncomfortable but will ease.
I'm 34 weeks and i have the same rib pain on the left side,  my doctor told me its from all the baby's kicking

Upper abdominal pain can be associated with HELP syndrome and HELP syndrome sometimes goes along with preeclampsia and eclampsia. Other symptoms are high blood pressure, protein in the urine, blurred vision, head ache, swelling in the hands and face and seizures.

question: Most of the time I have pain on the left side of rib under chest and also on the upper part of tummy. The tummy pain is more of like a stretching feeling which is so uncomfortable and wont go away. Is this normal for third trimester? Ive had it for a couple of weeks now especially in the evenings and when im laying on my side the middle part of ribs feel so sore like its about to break... :( im 31 weeks today.
title: is this normal? or could it mean pre ecclampsia?
